questions.question: ……………………… you take it or leave it.
questions.description: Either or is used to present an unavoidable choice between two alternatives.

questions.question: The doctor must come soon, ………………………. the patient will die.
……………………….. the doctor does not arrive soon, the patient will die.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: I can’t meet you tomorrow, ……………………….. I have an important appointment.
questions.description: For can refer to the reason for something in a formal style.

questions.question: …………………………….. they played well, they could not win.
questions.description: Even though is similar to though but it is more emphatic.

questions.question: I don’t know …………………………. I will have time or not.
questions.description: We use whether or if to introduce an yes/no question, but whether is preferred in the structure whether .. or not.

questions.question: We started early …………………………… we would not get stuck in traffic.
I shall lend you my camera ……………………………. you return it tomorrow.
The passengers got off the bus …………………………… it stopped.
He speaks ………………………….. he is a genius.
questions.description: As if and as though are used to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: …………………………. I become a millionaire, I will always be a socialist.
questions.description: Even if refers to the future. Even though refers to the past.

questions.question: …………………………… breaking his arm, he hurt his leg.
questions.description: All of these expressions mean the same.
